alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:35PM EST until January 13 at 12:20AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting Henrico and City of Richmond County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, City of Richmond and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Locks. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Rocketts Landing Park and the Virginia Capital Trail begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:54 PM EST Thursday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:54 PM EST Thursday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 13.4 feet late this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 03/24/1949. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM EST.
